ratings.comment: Lectures were optional but discussion attendance is graded. Pretty easy to get a good grade if you do your assignments on time. Not a lot, just a few short writing assignments (mostly graded by participation), some online quizzes, and a final paper. No exams
This class was insanely easy. Also, Gaber is a great prof. She provides grace periods, extra credit, and is super chill and understanding. If you need literature credits, this class is an easy A.

Interesting class taught effectively by Alice's lectures. She clearly cares about Roman history and takes a nuanced approach to teaching it, acknowledging the bias that certain sources may have and teaching us many different perspectives of historical events. There is a lot of reading though, and the final paper at the end is a bit tough.
